jparsec.graph.chartRendering

Class AWTGraphics

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.graph.chartRendering.AWTGraphics
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graphics

    public class AWTGraphics
extends java.lang.Object
implements Graphics
    Implements the Graphics interface for Java desktop platform, with anaglyph support and optional sub-pixel precision. This class contains fast implementations of drawLine and other methods from the PerfGraphics library at http://www.randelshofer.ch/oop/graphics/.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface jparsec.graph.chartRendering.Graphics

        Graphics.ANAGLYPH_COLOR_MODE, Graphics.FONT

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface jparsec.graph.chartRendering.Graphics

    • Constructor Detail

      • AWTGraphics

        public AWTGraphics(int w,
           int h,
           boolean invertH,
           boolean invertV)
        Creates a new Graphics provider for Java desktop platform, with no anaglyph mode. Antialiasing is enabled by default.
        Parameters:
        w - The width of the image to render.
        h - The height.
        invertH - True to invert image horizontally.
        invertV - True to invert image vertically.

      • AWTGraphics

        public AWTGraphics(int w,
           int h,
           boolean invertH,
           boolean invertV,
           java.awt.Graphics2D g,
           boolean generateImageAlso)
        Creates a new Graphics provider for Java desktop platform, with no anaglyph mode, suitable for an external Graphics object. Antialiasing is enabled by default.
        Parameters:
        w - The width of the image to render.
        h - The height.
        invertH - True to invert image horizontally.
        invertV - True to invert image vertically.
        g - The Graphics instance.
        generateImageAlso - True to generate also an image of the rendering. False is recommended to save memory and performance, when possible.

      • AWTGraphics

        public AWTGraphics(int w,
           int h,
           Graphics.ANAGLYPH_COLOR_MODE mode,
           boolean invertH,
           boolean invertV)
        Creates a new Graphics provider for Java desktop platform. Antialiasing is enabled by default.
        Parameters:
        w - The width of the image to render.
        h - The height.
        mode - The color mode, anaglyph or normal.
        invertH - True to invert image horizontally.
        invertV - True to invert image vertically.

      • AWTGraphics

        public AWTGraphics(int w,
           int h,
           boolean invertH,
           boolean invertV,
           java.awt.image.BufferedImage externalImage)
        Creates a new Graphics provider for Java desktop platform. Antialiasing is enabled by default.
        Parameters:
        w - The width of the image to render.
        h - The height.
        invertH - True to invert image horizontally.
        invertV - True to invert image vertically.
        externalImage - The external image to render to. The difference respect other constructors not using this parameter is a better performance when rendering to external graphics and anaglyph mode are not required.

    • Method Detail

      • setBufferedImageType

        public static void setBufferedImageType(int type)
        Sets the type of BufferedImage to be created. Default is RGB without transparency.
        Parameters:
        type - One of the BufferedImage#TYPE constants.

      • regenerate

        public void regenerate(int w,
              int h,
              Graphics.ANAGLYPH_COLOR_MODE mode,
              boolean invertH,
              boolean invertV)
        Regenerates the Graphics2D context in a fast way, without creating a new BufferedImage unless something in the input values changed from initial values. Antialiasing is enabled by default.
        Parameters:
        w - The width of the image to render.
        h - The height.
        mode - The color mode, anaglyph or normal.
        invertH - True to invert image horizontally.
        invertV - True to invert image vertically.

      • regenerate

        public void regenerate(int w,
              int h,
              boolean invertH,
              boolean invertV,
              java.awt.image.BufferedImage externalImage)
        Regenerates the Graphics2D context in a fast way, without creating a new BufferedImage unless something in the input values changed from initial values. Antialiasing is enabled by default.
        Parameters:
        w - The width of the image to render.
        h - The height.
        invertH - True to invert image horizontally.
        invertV - True to invert image vertically.
        externalImage - The external image to render to. The difference respect other constructors not using this parameter is a better performance when rendering to external graphics and anaglyph mode are not required.

             int[] j,
             int np,
             boolean fastMode)
        Description copied from interface: Graphics
        Draws a set of lines connected.
        Specified by:
        drawLines in interface Graphics
        Parameters:
        i - The set of x points.
        j - The set of y points.
        np - The number of lines to draw.
        fastMode - true to use fast mode, but with less quality. In particular, stroke, transparency, and antialiasing are not supported.

      • drawImage

        public void drawImage(java.lang.Object img,
             float x,
             float y,
             double scalex,
             double scaley)
        Description copied from interface: Graphics
        Draws an image at (x, y), with a given scale in x/y. This method is designed to support drawing images in (almost) vector graphics format for scaling factors lower than unity.
        Specified by:
        drawImage in interface Graphics
        Parameters:
        img - The image object, previously read using Graphics.getImage(String). For Java desktop it will an Image or ToolkitImage object.
        x - X position.
        y - Y position.
        scalex - Scaling factor in x axis.
        scaley - Scaling factor in y axis.

                 int life)
        Description copied from interface: Graphics
        Adds a given object to the database. This is currently used only in getImage method, so that the image returned is the one hold in the database, without wasting time in reading the file or doing some image processing. Not recommended in Android.
        Specified by:
        addToDataBase in interface Graphics
        Parameters:
        img - The image/object to save.
        id - The identifier. Use the path set in getImage.
        life - Life time in seconds in the database. <= 0 to keep it forever.

      • getScaledImage

        public java.lang.Object getScaledImage(java.lang.Object image,
                              int w,
                              int h,
                              boolean sameRatio,
                              boolean useSpline)
        Description copied from interface: Graphics
        Returns an scaled image.
        Specified by:
        getScaledImage in interface Graphics
        Parameters:
        image - The image.
        w - The width.
        h - The height.
        sameRatio - True to maintain the image w/h ratio.
        useSpline - True to allow using spline technique for resizing, in case the implementation supports it.
        Returns:
        The image object. For Java desktop it will a BufferedImage object.

      • getScaledImage

        public java.lang.Object getScaledImage(java.lang.Object image,
                              int w,
                              int h,
                              boolean sameRatio,
                              boolean useSpline,
                              int dy)
        Description copied from interface: Graphics
        Returns an scaled image.
        Specified by:
        getScaledImage in interface Graphics
        Parameters:
        image - The image.
        w - The width.
        h - The height.
        sameRatio - True to maintain the image w/h ratio.
        useSpline - True to allow using spline technique for resizing, in case the implementation supports it.
        dy - Number of pixels to move the image down. In case of not 0 the output image will be of greater size, recentered in vertical.
        Returns:
        The image object. For Java desktop it will a BufferedImage object.

      • getRotatedAndScaledImage

        public java.lang.Object getRotatedAndScaledImage(java.lang.Object image,
                                        float radius_x,
                                        float radius_y,
                                        float ang,
                                        float scalex,
                                        float scaley)
        Description copied from interface: Graphics
        Returns an scaled and/or rotated image.
        Specified by:
        getRotatedAndScaledImage in interface Graphics
        Parameters:
        image - The image.
        radius_x - The translation/rotation radius in x, it will be usually the width of the image * scale * 0.5.
        radius_y - The translation/rotation radius in y, it will be usually the height of the image * scale * 0.5.
        ang - Rotation angle in radians.
        scalex - Scale factor in x axis, after rotation.
        scaley - Scale factor in y axis, after rotation.
        Returns:
        The image object. For Java desktop it will a BufferedImage object.

        Description copied from interface: Graphics
        Draws an straight line from (x0, y0) to (xf, yf), for distances dist1 and dist2. x0 and xf or y0 and yf should be equal, otherwise a fast line method is called.
        Specified by:

        i - x0.
        j - y0.
        k - xf.
        l - yf.

        dist2 - Final distance point x1, y1.

      • drawLines

        public void drawLines(int[] i,
             int[] j,
             int np,
             float[] dist,
             boolean fastMode)
        Description copied from interface: Graphics
        Draws a set of lines connected.
        Specified by:
        drawLines in interface Graphics
        Parameters:
        i - The set of x points.
        j - The set of y points.
        np - The number of lines to draw.
        dist - The set of distances of each point.
        fastMode - true to use fast mode, but with less quality. In particular, stroke, transparency, and antialiasing are not supported.

      • drawImage

        public void drawImage(java.lang.Object img,
             float x,
             float y,
             float z,
             double scalex,
             double scaley)
        Description copied from interface: Graphics
        Draws an image at (x, y), distance z, and with a given scale in x/y. This method is designed to support drawing images in (almost) vector graphics format for scaling factors lower than unity.
        Specified by:
        drawImage in interface Graphics
        Parameters:
        img - The image object, previously read using Graphics.getImage(String). For Java desktop it will an Image or ToolkitImage object.
        x - X position.
        y - Y position.
        z - Distance.
        scalex - Scaling factor in x axis.
        scaley - Scaling factor in y axis.

      • blendImagesToAnaglyphMode

        public java.lang.Object blendImagesToAnaglyphMode(java.lang.Object l,
                                         java.lang.Object r)
        Description copied from interface: Graphics
        Creates an anaglyph image from left and right eye views. This method uses the method described in Conversion of a Stereo Pair to Anaglyph with the Lest-Squares Projection Method (2009), by Eric Dubois (for CRT/Plasma displays). The result is an anaglyph that can be viewed with a pair of 3d glasses with some color for the left eye, and another for the right one.
        Specified by:
        blendImagesToAnaglyphMode in interface Graphics
        Parameters:
        l - Left image. Should be in RGB color space.
        r - Right image. Should be in RGB color space.
        Returns:
        Anaglyph view in RGB color space, adequate for CRT/Plasma screens.

      • rotateShape

        public static java.awt.Shape rotateShape(java.awt.Shape s,
                         double angle)
        Rotates a Shape around its center using Shape's coordinates.
        Parameters:
        s - The shape.
        angle - The angle to rotate in radians.
        Returns:
        The new shape.

      • rotateShape

        public static java.awt.Shape rotateShape(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                         java.awt.Shape s,
                         double angle)
                                  throws JPARSECException
        Rotates a Shape around its center using the original Graphics2D coordinates. The transform eventually used in the Graphics2D is reverted, then the rotation is done, and then the transform is applied again. The Graphics2D is not modified, only the output shape.
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics2D object.
        s - The shape.
        angle - The angle to rotate in radians.
        Returns:
        The new shape.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the rotation cannot be applied to this shape.
